runs.comm: bowled on leg stump, Charles tries to work it on the leg side but misses
that's further down leg side, Charles doesn't bother playing it
defended from the crease on the leg side
bowled full and straight on off and middle, Charles blocks
he's bowling fairly quick, on off stump, Charles stays in his crease and plays to point
defended on the front foot to point
played off the back foot towards square leg, Charles plays out six dots
a length ball outside off, Gayle pushes forward and the ball goes towards point
good length on middle and off, pushed from the crease to cover
Charles clears his front foot and slogs wildly, he was nowhere near making contact as the ball slanted across him on a good length

caught behind! That's a sharp catch. Charles' feet were rooted to the crease as he tried to cut a good length ball that angled across him. He didn't have much room and got a thick outside edge that flew very quickly to Akmal's right. He managed to stick his right glove out and grab it
Samuels gets behind the line and defends towards the bowler
Samuels goes back and defends a good length ball
Gayle strides forward and defends as Hafeez delivers from round the wicket

Afridi flings the ball in the air after taking a simple catch at cover! Gayle leaned forward and closed the face against the ball angling into him from round the wicket, it lobbed off the leading edge straight to the fielder. Gayle's wretched form continues, he's dismissed on 999 T20 international runs
Hafeez goes over the wicket and bowls a tight length on off stump, Simmons defends
Simmons gets down on one knee and slog sweeps to deep midwicket
driven off the front foot to mid-off, Babar fumbles and allows the single
played back to the bowler

caught behind, West Indies are being shredded. Tanvir pitches on a good length in line with the stumps from over the wicket and gets the ball to bounce sharply as it angles across Samuels, who is caught in his crease as he prods at the ball, it hits the outside edge and Akmal takes another one
moves across his crease and works the ball off his pads through square leg
defended towards midwicket
in the blockhole outside off stump, that was a slower one, the batsman stayed in his crease and played it out towards point
short of a length and straight, the batsman sways out of the line
defended from the crease on the off side
bowled flat and quick on middle, played off the back foot to midwicket
a slower ball on middle and leg, driven from the crease through wide mid-on
punched off the front foot to cover
Simmons gets down on one knee and tries to slam the ball behind square, he misses and is hit on the pad
played to short fine leg
once again Simmons glances the ball to the man at short fine
a length ball on middle and off, no room to work with and Bravo defends from his crease on the off side
Bravo sees some width and tries to play an extravagant square drive, he is beaten by a slightly slower ball
another slower ball outside off stump, Bravo does not play a shot
Bravo punches a length ball towards long-off, didn't use much power in the stroke, just jumped back and pushed at it
poor line, a rare loose ball from Tanvir, it was on leg stump and it kept a touch low too, Bravo jumped back and glanced it fine past the keeper
good length and straight, Bravo defends towards mid-on and runs once he sees the fielder is slow to approach the ball
pitches outside off stump and spins away, the batsman lets it go
another one pitches outside off and turns away, takes the outside edge and falls short of slip
defended back to the bowler
worked off the front foot towards square leg
that's the one that goes on with the arm and it beats the defence and hits the pad

a huge, huge appeal. The Pakistan players cannot believe it hasn't been given. I'll have more detail for you in a moment. the ball skidded into the right-hander and the ball hit the top of the pad and lodged in Akmal's gloves. Akmal was convinced about the catch (or maybe it was the lbw?) and so he charged towards the umpire, not realising Bravo was well out of the crease and he could have stumped him
the slider on off and middle, played off the back foot to point
played back to the bowler
played towards square leg for a single
defended back to the bowler
defended on the leg side
bowled between bat and pad! Simmons pushed forward to defend but left a sizeable gap between the bat and the front pad. Afridi went straight through it with a straighter one and hit middle stump
defended on the leg side from the crease
Narine is caught in his crease and gets an inside edge past his stumps, poor running too, they should have got three
driven to long-on for a single
played off the back foot to Afridi at midwicket
steps out of his crease but isn't to the pitch of the ball and has to adjust and play it to midwicket
that's a wide down leg side
Afridi in action at midwicket once again after Bravo plays it to him off the back foot
played off the back foot through square leg
that's a shot! Bravo sparks the crowd into life by launching the ball cleanly cover the long-off boundary. That's the second boundary of the innings
played towards short third man
played off the back foot through midwicket
a full toss, Narine taps it through midwicket for two more
and that's why, evidently. Narine gets under a short ball from Afridi and pulls it so far that it clears the roof beyond the square leg boundary
Bravo stays in his crease and nudges the offbreak to midwicket
goes back to pull but mis-times it to Afridi at midwicket
worked off the front foot and this time he places it wide of Afridi at midwicket
Narine moves back and across and defends to the bowler with a straight bat
Narine moves his front leg across and chips it through midwicket
flicked off the front foot through midwicket
his first ball is a poor one, down leg side, Bravo tries to pull and misses. The umpire does not call it wide. It should have been one
Bravo makes room by moving outside leg and throws his bat at a short of a length ball outside off, he makes contact with the bottom of the bat and sends the ball over cover, it plugs in the outfield
he leans into a fuller ball and plays an exquisite drive through extra cover, he transferred his weight into the shot and hammered it
in the blockhole and Bravo hops around in pain after he jams it out
worked off the pads, they take on the fielder at short fine leg and succeed
a full ball in the blockhole outside off stump, Narine is beaten
played with an open face to short third man for a single
Narine winds up and has a tremendous slog across the line, he gets an inside edge that just misses leg stump and races to the boundary
oh my, that's nearly taken Babar's hands off! Narine lines him up and hammers the ball back at the bowler, just above head height, the ball was past him before the bowler could get his hands up
this time he tries to reverse whack it and misses
Narine swings hard again and hits the ball through square leg, giving Haris lots of work to do on the boundary
a full toss and Narine clips it along the ground through midwicket

that's high, but has it gone far enough? Afridi's on the edge of the backward square leg boundary and I think he has misjudged it. The ball falls beyond his outstretched hand behind his head and pitches just inside the boundary. He thought he was much closer to the rope than he actually was. Narine had gone deep into his crease and heaved at the ball
Narine charges and flat bats the ball towards the bowler, Ajmal moves to his left and fields
there's no mis-judgement this time! Narine heaved at the ball and hit it straight to Umar Amin at long-on, he had to run in to take the catch. Narine's done the job he was sent to do though
bowled quick on middle stump, defended on the back foot
there's width outside off and Bravo waits on the back foot and cuts to deep point
Pollard stays in his crease and defends with a straight bat
Bravo clears his front foot and heaves across the line at a delivery that spins sharply away from the right-hander, Akmal attempts a stumping but Bravo's back foot was grounded
played off the back foot towards point
Pollard nudges the ball off his pads behind square
Bravo was already standing way outside off stump, leaving all his stumps exposed, as he clipped the ball through midwicket
played off the back foot towards long-on
shorter length, Bravo will feel he missed out there, he went back and drove the ball hard but did not beat the fielder at cover
played off the back foot through mid off
Bravo drives off the back foot but hits it to Afridi at cover
steps out of his crease and works the ball through midwicket
driven off the back foot towards point, Afridi moves to his left and fields
Bravo makes room by moving towards leg and tries to blast over the off side, he misses

played along the ground to deep square leg and the second run is extremely risky, the throw from the deep is wide of the stumps though and Bravo's bat is just over the line by the time Akmal breaks them. It's an extremely close call, and after several replays the third umpire rules in Bravo's favour.

that's a massive hit! Pollard charges the bowler and Babar delivers right into the hitting zone, Pollard frees those huge arms and gives it a mighty whack, sending the ball high and far over long-on, it's out of the ground and they will need a new ball. The old one is on the roof.
another muscular hit straight down the ground and it beats the boundary riders, he backed away outside leg and smashed it

they will need another ball now! This one has gone miles! Pollard charged the bowler again, got to the pitch of the ball and hammered it straight, and so high that it cleared the roof this time. They've got the old one back, so they will replace the new ball with the old ball
that's a fine stop by Azam at long-off, but hang on, he fumbles it because of the speed of the ball and it goes over the boundary. Pollard had backed away to leg and hit the ball hard down the ground

this time he holes out! Pollard made room by moving outside leg but instead of hitting straight, which is where he was aiming, he ended up slicing the ball over cover. Haris came in from the boundary and judged the catch well

after conceding all those runs, Babar's taken out both batsmen! Bravo made room and tried to clear the wide long-off boundary, he did not hit it far enough and Azam ran to his left from long off and took the catch. And just as quickly as the chase sparked to life, it has fizzled out ...
I think that's missed everything, the bat, the pads and the keeper and run to the boundary. Apparently the batsman got a bit of an edge on that
Barnwell makes great contact, getting on to the front foot and driving fluently to the cover boundary
played towards backward point for a single
Sammy clears his front leg and drives to long-on for a single
Afridi thinks he's got him lbw and I think so too, but the umpire does not. Barnwell got down on one knee to slog sweep and missed. He was hit plumb in front on the back leg

Barnwell's been run out! He played the ball to deep midwicket and ran the single and then hared back for the second, putting in a desperate dive too. The throw from Azam was good and the keeper broke the stumps with Barnwell's stretched bat just short

this is such ridiculous cricket. Sammy tried to pull the ball over deep midwicket and ended up top edging it straight up in the air. the ball was landing in the middle of the pitch and both the bowler and the keeper went for the catch. They eventually bumped into each other and dropped it
Sammy tries to heave behind square but misses and is hit on the thigh
the ninth wicket falls, Sammy clears his front foot and tries to clear the straight boundary, he only succeeds in hitting it to Afridi at long off
Best has hit this far enough! He charged the bowler and muscled the ball over Afridi's head on the long off boundary

Ajmal slanted the ball across the right-hander from round the wicket and beat the outside edge. Akmal whipped off the bails and appealed for a stumping. Did Best lift his back leg? He did, but it was back down in time
Best charges again and heaves the ball over extra cover, Afridi runs to his left from long off to field
the first ball is a no ball, played to backward point for a single. Free-hit coming up. I'm not sure how that is a no ball. The back foot did not touch the side crease and the front foot was fine.
the slower ball outside off stump, Best swings hard but misses
clears his front foot and slogs through midwicket, he's not timed it well so they can run two because the fielder has to run in from the boundary to get to the ball
Best is reducing the margin of defeat here, he clears his front leg, gets under a slower ball and blitzes it over the straight boundary. Or have I spoken too soon?
it's in the blockhole outside off stump, Best can't get bat on it and he swings his bat in frustration after missing the shot
it's a slower ball that nearly shaves leg stump after Best fails to connect with his swing
and that's that, Pakistan take the series 2-0. The last ball is carved out through cover for a single
